description: Repeatedly apply Euler phi to n-th prime; a(n) is the number terms in iteration chains which are not powers of 2 (number of initial iterations until reaching first power of 2).
example: n=100,p(100)=541, Phi-iteration chain is {541,540,144,48,16,8,4,2,1} with 9 terms. The first 4 terms (541,540,144,48) are not powers of 2, som a(100)=4.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Apr 13 2001
